intro: Coryphantha retusa, commonly known as the slender coryphantha, is a species of flowering plant in the family Cactaceae. It is native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico, where it thrives in arid and semi-arid environments. The plant is characterized by its cylindrical, ribbed stems and clusters of yellow flowers that bloom in the spring. Its succulent structure allows it to store water, making it well adapted to drought conditions. Coryphantha retusa is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its unique appearance and resilience.
